content.raw:
It seems we have different rules of thumb on when to choose which debug level. I thought that `gzdbg` should print enough information to allow the user to basically debug the plugin even without looking into the source code.

Also, I don't fully understand your point in the second sentence. First, you tell the logging is a bit spammy, and then you tell we should do more logging? Or should I understand it like "use less `gzdbg`s, use the other log levels instead"?
content.html:
It seems we have different rules of thumb on when to choose which debug level. I thought that gzdbg should print enough information to allow the user to basically debug the plugin even without looking into the source code.

Also, I don't fully understand your point in the second sentence. First, you tell the logging is a bit spammy, and then you tell we should do more logging? Or should I understand it like "use less gzdbgs, use the other log levels instead"?
